oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Retrospective study of retroperitoneal abscess in cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ferraro, S.
Desrochers, A.
Nichols, S.
Francoz, D.
Babkine, M.
Larde, H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: abscess
peritoneum
transverse oblique
internal oblique
laparotomy
case-series
treatment
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A retroperitoneal abscess is a collection of suppurative fluid between the peritoneum, the transverse and internal oblique muscles. It was reported in cattle following laparotomy. The objectives of this retrospective cases-series study are to describe the clinical signs, clinical pathological findings, treatment options and outcome.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2017; 235-236
